intro: Styphelia mucronata, commonly known as the mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils in forested areas. Styphelia mucronata is often found in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks and in mountainous regions.
